ARABIC: وَٱتْرُكِ ٱلْبَحْرَ رَهْوًا إِنَّهُمْ جُندٌ مُّغْرَقُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Leave the sea divided as it is. They are an army who will be drowned.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (Cross and) leave the sea undisturbed. The (pursuing) hosts will surely be drowned,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And leave the sea behind you as calm as ever. Surely they are an army that is doomed to be drowned.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Cross the sea by cutting a path through it. Pharaoh's army will be drowned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And leave the sea as it is, parted in several places; indeed that army will be drowned.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And leave the sea as it is (quiet and divided). Verily, they are a host to be drowned."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And leave the sea intervening; surely they are a host that shall be drowned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And leave the sea becalmed; they are a drowned host.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And leave the sea behind at rest, for lo! they are a drowned host.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Leave the sea behind you parted; they are a host destined to be drowned."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And leave thou the sea divided: verily they are a host to be drowned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Leave behind the sea unmoving; for they will be a drowned host.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And leave the sea as a furrow (divided): for they are a host (destined) to be drowned."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And leave the sea as it is (quiet and divided). Verily, They are a host to be drowned."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Then leave the sea calm they are an army that will be drowned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And cross the sea quickly; they are an army to be drowned.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And leave the sea in stillness. Indeed, they are an army to be drowned."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [44:24] And leave the sea behind, once you and your companions have crossed it, at rest, still and calm, until the Egyptians enter it: indeed they will be a drowned host’ — he [Moses] was reassured by this [statement] — and they were [indeed] drowned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 576 (And leave the sea behind at rest) spacious roads, spacious enough for Moses and his folk to pass through them, (for lo! they are a drowned host) Pharaoh and his folk will be drowned in the sea.
